A concrete example

Lisa is a freelancer and Steve is her client. Steve wants to have Lisa build a brand new website.

Neither want to go through a platform that will charge expensive fees, so Lisa signs up to Freelancer Protocol as a freelancer.

//photo 1

She creates a project called Steve’s website and sets steve@gmail.com as the client email. She could redact the milestone then send it to him, but today she chooses to share the project so he can create the milestone himself.

Steve is pinged by email, and taken directly to the project when he signs up as a client. He adds a milestone called “Homepage”. He believes it’s a good start to his website project and inserts 10 days as a deadline.

He previews then sends the milestone.

//photo 2

//photo 3

//photo 4 Steve gets an email and signs up as a client. He writes the milestone specs previews and presses send.

He also enters his payment info as that’s needed for the milestone to start.

Both are informed the milestone has started. Lisa can now start the work !

//photo 5 Steve logs in and goes to his project. He creates a first milestone, prveviews and sends.

Steve and Lisa both get a notification.
